ref: 1614 īráyati ʻ causes to rise, brings to life, utters ʼ RV. [Cf. údīrayati ʻ causes ʼ RV.: √īr]
Pa. īrita -- ʻ set in motion, uttered ʼ;
Sh. (Lor.) iroiki ʻ to stretch and fix warp in position for weaving ʼ (→
Ḍ. iriná ʻ to stretch or set up the warp ʼ); <->
Ḍ. iriná ʻ to say, to do ʼ caus. irāna ʻ to cause to be made ʼ: in the latter and even in both meanings perh. rather < karṓti with abnormal loss of k -- in the verb ʻ to do ʼ.
